slidelink.displaytext: Discussing HCI and vSAN to Customers
What’s in It for You: Why Sell vSAN?
Major Trends Lining Up for an Even Better 2017

search.slidetext: hyper-converged infrastructure solutions overview this module will take approximately 45 minutes.

objectives by the end of this course, you will be able to: present vmware vsan™ and hyper-converged infrastructure to customers discover customer problems that can be addressed by the vsan capabilities of hyper-converged infrastructure match the customer’s problems and needs with the vsan capabilities that will meet those needs recommend the vmware solution that will be the best value for the customer respond to possible customer questions and objections

discussing hci and vsan to customers evolve without risk lower tco scale to tomorrow

you are speaking with a c-level executive who has little technical knowledge. which of the following is the best way to explain “hyper-converged infrastructure” to this customer? hyper-converged infrastructure is when all the virtualized elements of an infrastructure, such as virtual machines and virtual switches, are brought together into a single virtual pool. hyper-converged infrastructure slidetranscripts.slidetranscript: Welcome to the Hyper-Converged Infrastructure Solutions Overview.

In this course, you will learn about the value vSAN brings to customers and how it is a key enabling technology for the Hyper-Converged Data Center.

Here you will explore how vSAN addresses key customer challenges. You will learn about the customer profiles that are a good match for vSAN and identify key triggers that point to a vSAN and HCI opportunity. This course also covers sales incentives and tools.

Take a moment to review the objectives.

What is Hyper-Converged Infrastructure?

Hyper-Converged Infrastructure, or HCI, is a software-centric architecture that tightly integrates compute and storage virtualization resources in standard x86 servers. This hyper-converged infrastructure is key for the customer's software-defined data center, enabling a building block approach with scale-out capabilities.

HCI consists of vCenter Server, vSphere, and VMware's virtual storage area network software, vSAN. vCenter Server provides unified management capabilities, and vSphere provides the hypervisor, compute, and networking capabilities. vSAN provides the hyper-converged storage.

Most of your customers have vSphere and vCenter Server, so they are already two-thirds of the way there. All your customers need to do is add vSAN to create an HCI environment and all of its benefits.

When presenting vSAN and HCI to customers, it's important to aim high in the organization. Make your pitch a strategic discussion with c-level executives about evolving without risk, lowering total cost of ownership, or TCO, and scaling to tomorrow.

You will face a lot of competition in every deal. This course helps you clearly articulate the unique benefits of VMware's HCI solution, and how customers can enjoy the benefits of the hyper-converged infrastructure just by adding vSAN to their existing vSphere infrastructure. vSAN is one of our hottest products and there is a good reason. No other vendor provides such a comprehensive, seamless, and scalable solution. And no one else can offer a path to the modern data center that is as reliable, cost-effective, and easy-to-manage as VMware.

Why sell vSAN? The answer is simple.

vSAN provides a superior virtual storage solution. vSAN provides a clear and easy path to a modern infrastructure. For many companies, it is the first step to adopting a software-defined, hyper-converged infrastructure. vSAN leads to larger strategic discussions about modern infrastructure and the modern data center solutions that our customers want. It allows you to take control of accounts against competitors and over the long term, it simplifies and eases migrations to and from the cloud. When discussing vSAN, always aim high in the organization and focus first on the strategic advantages that vSAN brings, and how it leads seamlessly to a fully hyper-converged infrastructure.

On the revenue side, you can develop multi-year revenue pipelines based on vSAN, NSX, and Cloud Foundation. The vRealize suite and Horizon are valuable add-ons with repeat buys in 2016 of 25 percent and project repeat buys estimated at 35 percent in 2017.

vSAN is growing very fast. There are now more than 8,000 vSAN customers, and that customer base is growing faster than any of our competitors. vSAN is in fact the fastest growing product in terms of customer count that VMware has.

And vSAN is also growing faster than our competition. This graph shows vSAN adoption versus Nutanix.

vSAN boasts a software run rate of $300 million dollars. And 100 percent of industry verticals use vSAN. And VMware is winning a lot of awards with vSAN. The adoption with customers has been tremendous, with great feedback on vSAN and its features.

The strength of the vSAN product and market dynamics in general will drive even greater growth going forward.

Intel is releasing a new generation of server CPUs this year. This kind of release by Intel spurs server OEMs to refresh their product lines, which in turn leads customers to rethink their data center hardware models. This creates significant opportunities to have strategic discussions around IT and infrastructure, and vSAN is a great way to lead that discussion.

Flash is getting cheaper and denser. All-Flash designs today are extremely popular, and there is no sign of this trend slowing down. That’s great news because it’s easier to sell all-flash, it’s easier to design and size the servers, and it’s easier to work out the costs.

The vSAN product continues to get better. With the 6.6 release, we will have added native HCI data encryption, which is very important if you are having security discussions with your customers. There are also new management pieces in place. With these additions, vSAN can meet just about every data service requirement that our customers have.

And with our bigger and bigger base of customers we’re seeing a high propensity to come back and buy more vSAN. In fact, we are seeing some customers who are buying more vSAN every 3 to 6 months as they switch more and more of their core storage needs over to vSAN.
